timeline.author: costin

replies.bodyText: The client in the ESRestTestCase base class is created on @before, so this is done in order to get the initialized client but still synchronize the setup and do it once in case the tests are run in parallel.
replies.author: aleksmaus

timeline.bodyText:
You could use the approach used in SQL:
  
    
      elasticsearch/x-pack/plugin/sql/qa/src/main/java/org/elasticsearch/xpack/sql/qa/jdbc/SpecBaseIntegrationTestCase.java
    
    
         Line 60
      in
      8279f82
    
    
    
    

        
          
           public void setupTestDataIfNeeded() throws Exception { 
        
    
  

, that is on each test check whether the index exists - if it doesn't load the data, otherwise ignore it.
And wipe the data in a @AfterClass. Note that you could do the loading inside @BeforeClass as well if there are no modifications to the index at all.
timeline.author: costin

replies.bodyText: The client from the base class only available on after @before hook. Unless I hack around that, the safest bet is to initialize on @before and since I need to initialize it once that's why synchronizing on the class
replies.author: aleksmaus

timeline.message: Update jtoml-LICENSE and jtom-NOTICE files content
Remove 'synchronize' locks  on the tests data setup/teardown per code review request.
